meanings.definition: A malignant tumor of epithelial tissue.
meanings.sent1: The doctor diagnosed the patient with carcinoma.
meanings.sent2: She underwent surgery to remove the carcinoma from her lung.
meanings.sent3: The carcinoma thought it could outsmart the doctors, but it was wrong.
meanings.sent4: The spread of rumors in the small town was like a carcinoma, growing uncontrollably.
meanings.sent5: The image of the carcinoma invading the healthy cells was terrifying.

meanings.definition: A cancer arising in the epithelial tissue of the skin or of the lining of the internal organs.
meanings.sent1: His grandfather battled carcinoma for years before succumbing to it.
meanings.sent2: Regular screenings can help detect carcinoma early.
meanings.sent3: The carcinoma on the skin seemed like a rebellious patch that refused to leave.
meanings.sent4: The spread of negativity in the office was like a carcinoma, affecting everyone.
meanings.sent5: The doctor's urgent tone conveyed the seriousness of the carcinoma diagnosis.
